IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: MOORE CENTER SERVICES, INC. PROVIDES A WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES TO DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED INDIVIDUALS IN THE GREATER MANCHESTER, NH AREA.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Our mission is to empower and support individuals with developmental disabilities and acquired brain disorders, thereby enriching the lives of everyone in our community.
IRS990.Description: RESIDENTIAL SERVICES - PROVISION OF HOUSING (APARTMENTS AND STAFFED RESIDENCES) TO CLIENTS.

Activity2.Description: DAY SERVICES - PROVISION OF JOB ORIENTED HABILITATION SERVICES TO CLIENTS

Activity3.Description: DAY & RESIDENTIAL COMBINED SERVICES - PROVISION OF HOUSING IN A FAMILY SETTING TO CLIENTS

ActivityOther.Description: SERVICE COORDINATOR SERVICES - CASE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES PROVIDED (E.G. SERVICE COORDINATION, ADVOCACY, FACILITATION AND MONITORING).

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The organization holds client funds, pass-through funds held for others restricted to payments for services. The funds are only held for others and are not the property of Moore Center Services, Inc.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The funds are intended to be used in a manner consistent with the organization's mission.

FIN 48 Footnote: Effective July 1, 2009, management has adopted the accounting standard which requires recognition of the tax benefit of an uncertain tax position only if management determines that it is more likely than not that the tax position would be sustained upon examination by taxing authorities based on the technical merit of the position. Management has determined that the adoption of this standard had no affect on net assets as of July 1, 2009 and, as of June 30,2010, the Agency and its related organization have not taken any tax positions which do not meet the criteria for recognition. Tax filings for the tax years ending before June 30, 2006 are no longer subject to examination by Federal taxing authorities.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Organization does not make grants. The Organization does provide other assistance to individuals based on each individual's benefit eligibility and spending guidelines, as determined by Medicaid rules.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Organization agreed to pay the FICA tax obligations related to deferred compensation earned by its senior management employees.
The Organization does not have written policy. Payments are made in accordance with executive committee's instructions/approval.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1: NH Health and Education Facilities Authority

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: acquire new facility, refinance existing debt

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Family Member of the organization's CEO
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: The interest person is the president/ceo of an entity which provides various care services to the organization's clients. the amounts paid to this entity for these services is shown in(c) above

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Preparer provides draft of Form 990 to management for review. Once Form 990 has been approved by management, a draft is forwarded to the governing body for their review.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Moore Center's attorney attends the December board meeting and explains the requirements of the conflict of interest policy as well as the directors' obligations related thereto.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive Committee of the Board is responsible for evaluating the performance of the CEO and setting his/her compensation. This is done on an annual basis. In setting compensation the Executive Committee may refer to external information such as salary surveys or compensation studies to assist in their decision-making. Decisions are reflected in minutes of the meeting and are implemented through the staff action process by the CFO as directed by the Board Chair/Chair of the Executive Committee.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: the organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.
No change from prior year, in the process of overseeing the financial statement audit and the selection of the independent auditor.
THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT RECEIVE THESE TYPES OF CONTRIBUTIONS
Assistance to interested persons is provided on terms similar to assistance provided to other non-interested persons, and such assistance is in furtherance of the organization's exempt purpose.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Moore Realty has advanced funds to Moore Center Services

NameOfOtherOrganization.BusinessNameLine1: Moore Realty Inc (Co-Obligor on bank loan)
